alert.note: Alert for North Laramie Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 2:59AM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TUESDAY TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches. Localized areas up to 15 inches possible. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph Tuesday afternoon. Then, winds gusting up to 20 to 30 mph at times Tuesday night through Wednesday night. * WHERE...North Laramie Range, Southwest Carbon County and Upper North Platte River Basin. * WHEN...From 2 PM Tuesday to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: North Laramie Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
